sentence2_translated: Àwọn ẹgbẹ́ yìí ló ń ṣe ìdá méjì nínú àwọn tó wà nínú ẹgbẹ́ náà.

sentence2: Thumairy is not known to have ever been part of any mosque.
sentence2_translated: A kò mọ̀ pé Thumairy ti wà nínú ilé ìjọsìn kankan rí.

sentence2: Information sharing barriers were still in place after two years.
sentence2_translated: Lẹ́yìn ọdún méjì, àwọn ohun tó ń dáàbò bo àwọn èèyàn lórí ọ̀ràn ìsọfúnni ṣì wà.

sentence2: The Director did not believe that information sharing barriers should be entirely removed.
sentence2_translated: Olùdarí náà kò gbà pé ó yẹ kí a mú àwọn àtakò tó wà nínú pípín ìsọfúnni kúrò pátápátá.

sentence2: The Director immediately abolished all information sharing barriers.
sentence2_translated: Olùdarí náà mú gbogbo ohun tó ń dáàbò bo àwọn èèyàn kúrò lójú ẹsẹ̀.

sentence2: The fire was hot enough to melt some of the glass windows in the area.
sentence2_translated: Ńṣe ni iná náà gbóná débi pé ó mú kí àwọn ìrọ̀lẹ́ kan lára àwọn fèrèsé inú àgbègbè náà túútúú.

sentence2: The fireball traveled down at least one elevator shaft.
sentence2_translated: Bọ́ọ̀lù iná náà rìnrìn àjò lọ síbi ìkòkò ìdìdì kan.

sentence2: The jet fuel pooled on the ground but did not ignite.
sentence2_translated: Wọ́n kó epo náà jọ sórí ilẹ̀, àmọ́ kò ja.

sentence2: Helocopters could not be flown near the roofs due to fires in the area.

sentence2: The operators did not know that rooftop rescues were impossible.

sentence2: The operators knew well in advance that they had to instruct everyone to evacuate from the ground.

sentence2: All of the 9/11 attackers were denied entry at the border.

sentence2: Several of the attackers were initially flagged for extra inspections.

sentence2: They received extra inspections because they wore funny looking hats.

sentence2: After 9/11 the effort increased dramatically.
sentence2_translated: Lẹ́yìn 9/11, ìsapá náà pọ̀ sí i gan-an.

sentence2: After 9/11 the effort was abandoned entirely in favor of different tactics.
sentence2_translated: Lẹ́yìn 9/11 ni wọ́n fi gbogbo ìsapá náà sílẹ̀ pátápátá, wọ́n sì wá lo ọ̀nà mìíràn.

sentence2: Since 9/11 funding for the effort has increased by 120%.
sentence2_translated: Látìgbà 9/11 ni owó tí wọ́n ń ná fún ìsapá yìí ti pọ̀ sí i ní ìdá ọgọ́fà nínú ọgọ́rùn-ún.

sentence2: Financial tracking primarily involves examining credit card receipts and bank statements.

sentence2: Some Treasury officials did not believe the CIA valued financial tracking.

sentence2: The CIA relied on financial tracking as it's primary counter terrorism tool.

sentence2: The US government spends $7 billion on military intelligence each year.
